gr.interamerican.bo2.utils.meta.descriptors
Interface BoPropertyDescriptor<T>

Type Parameters:
T - Type of property.
All Superinterfaces:
Labeled, Named, Serializable
All Known Subinterfaces:
NumberBoPropertyDescriptor<T>
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractBoPropertyDescriptor, AbstractCacheRelatedObjectBoPropertyDescriptor, AbstractIntTypesBoPropertyDescriptor, AbstractNumberBoPropertyDescriptor, BigDecimalBoPropertyDescriptor, BooleanBoPropertyDescriptor, CachedEntryBoPropertyDescriptor, CachedEntryOwnerBoPropertyDescriptor, DateBoPropertyDescriptor, DoubleBoPropertyDescriptor, FloatBoPropertyDescriptor, IntegerBoPropertyDescriptor, LongBoPropertyDescriptor, MoneyBoPropertyDescriptor, MultipleCachedEntriesBoPropertyDescriptor, MultipleCachedEntriesOwnersBoPropertyDescriptor, PalleteCachedEntriesBoPropertyDescriptor, PalleteCachedEntriesOwnersBoPropertyDescriptor, SelectableBoPropertyDescriptor, SelectionBoPropertyDescriptor, StringBoPropertyDescriptor, TranslatableBoPropertyDescriptorWrapper
public interface BoPropertyDescriptor<T>
extends Named, Labeled, Serializable

Generic interface for the specification of a business property. Business objects properties are associated with the javabean properties of business objects but they don't describe exactly the same thing. A java bean property descriptor describes the property from a java development perspective. The BoPropertyDescriptor describes the property from a user perspective. This is a different perspective than the code, for instance a javabean property could be invisible to the user, another property could be modifiable by the code, but read-only for the user.
The name BoPropertyDescriptor stands for Business Object Property Descriptor.
